title: Emmaus field hockey standout Alicia Cooperman sings her heart out
text:
Alicia Cooperman (Tom Hinkel | For lehighvalleylive.com) 
Alicia Cooperman wanted to do something special on Senior Night at Emmaus High School. 
The Green Hornets senior field hockey standout has always had a passion for singing. She’d never sung the National Anthem at a public event, so what better time to do it than before the last regular season home game of her career. 
Cooperman performed the song flawlessly, then she and her teammates went out and improved to 16-0 overall and 14-0 in the Eastern Pennsylvania Conference on Tuesday night with a 3-0 victory over visiting Whitehall . 
“Being my first time, it was a little nerve-wracking,” Cooperman said. “I tried my best.” 
Cooperman showed plenty of poise with her solo act. She sang the song with a steady tempo and pace, and displayed a strong, consistent voice that never showed signs of quivering. 
RELATED : Emmaus field hockey's 'Kiddie Corp' steals the show on Senior Night 
“I tried not to get too nervous because it makes it easier and your voice isn’t as shaky,” she said. “At least I had my teammates to support me if I messed up. Even if I did they would have said I did a great job, anyway.” 
Has Cooperman always had a strong voice? 
“I’d like to think so,” said Cooperman, who’s also done musicals. 
Cooperman has made a verbal commitment to continue her career at James Madison University in Virginia. 
At the age of 5 she began taking Kung Fu classes at her stepfather’s school. After several years of training she became a black sash in 2008, a second degree black sash in 2009, and a third degree black sash in 2012. 
As a fourth grader she played the role of Blielke (the youngest daughter) in Fiddler on the Roof, which was performed at Muhlenberg College. 
Cooperman was an Honorable Mention All-State selection in field hockey last season. This year she is one of the team’s tri-captains. 
Of all her many interests, she says singing and field hockey have always been at the top of her list. 
“Ever since I was young,” she said, “I’ve always stuck with (singing) and field hockey.”
